data.decision: Next improvement priorities for Duro: (1) Auto-link decisions to evidence on validate/reverse, (2) Fact hygiene with fact_type/ttl_days/pinned/source + auto-expire test artifacts, (3) Domain-specific rules from incident RCAs (max 5, keep sharp), (4) Proactive recall as hard gate with confidence cap if skipped, (5) Anti-gaming measures for score model, (6) External truth integration via real messy workflows
data.rationale: Current state: autonomy engine works but doesn't truly learn. Decisions have 0 linked episodes (vibes-based reputation). Facts are 448 but mostly test spam (memory landfill). Rules are generic safety, no domain scars. Proactive recall is discipline-dependent (fragile). Need to turn engine into living system that produces trust.
alternatives: Focus only on skill validation (easier but doesn't fix trust)
Full rewrite of memory system (too disruptive)
data.context: Post-reflection on 9 days of Duro evolution. Infrastructure exists but habits don't. Biggest risks: governance theater by omission, memory junkyard.
